content: this is a summary of a legal text regarding a court decision made by the district court in ljubljana the decision identified as iv 1792021 was made on january 25 2022 the court fee for this legal procedure was 0 eur the procedure lasted from january 13 2021 to january 25 2022 which is a total of 1 year and 12 days the case involves the distribution of goods and funds from a personal account as well as unpaid pension benefits the first heir who is the son will receive half and the second heir who is the daughter will also receive half the court received the death certificate of the deceased on january 8 2021 which stated that the deceased was divorced and had a son and a daughter the probate court followed the inheritance act and determined that the deceaseds estate would be inherited by their children and spouse according to the legal succession order the court then held a probate hearing to determine the distribution of the deceaseds movable property among the heirs the heirs were informed of the hearing and accepted their legitimate share of the inheritance as a result the court declared the heirs as the first order of succession with each receiving half of the estate the value of the estate has been determined based on information provided in a death certificate and land register the heirs must make arrangements to transfer the property and withdraw funds once the decision of succession becomes final the court will assess the net value of the estate after deducting average funeral expenses and court fees if the appellant wishes to file an appeal they have 15 days from receiving a written copy of the decision to do so the appeal must be submitted to the court with enough copies for all parties involved and will be decided by the ljubljana high court it is important to submit the appeal on time and by registered post the appeal must include a statement of the order being appealed whether it is being challenged in whole or in part and the grounds for the appeal it must also be signed by the appellant if the appeal is missing any of these elements or is incomprehensible the court will ask the appellant to correct it or it will be dismissed if the appeal is filed by a proxy the proxy must be a lawyer who has passed the state lawyers examination otherwise the appeal will be dismissed the appellant must also pay a court fee when filing the appeal if the fee is not paid within the specified time limit or if the appellant qualifies for an exemption or deferment of payment the appeal will be considered withdrawn
